div.script: jsnThemeClassicjQuery(function() {jsnThemeClassicjQuery("#jsn-themeclassic-galleria-CzkRN").galleria({autoplay:6000,thumbnails: false,showImagenav: true,pauseOnInteraction: false,showInfo: false,infoPanelShowTitle: true,infoPanelShowDescription: true,imageClickAction:false,showImageLink:false,loop:true,thumbHeight:50,thumbPosition:"bottom",imageCrop: true,informationPanelClickAction:false,height:300, initialTransition: "fade", transition: "slide", thumbCrop: false, thumbFit: false, thumbQuality: false, showCounter: false, imageTimeout: 300000});});

div.p: Another week of the 2019-2020 school year is in the books. A year that we will never forget for all the wrong reasons. As I stated last week, our continuity of education plan will start to look different for the fourth quarter, which begins on Monday, April 20th and ends on Friday, June 5th. Teachers will begin moving from an enrichment and review model to the introduction of new material. Our goal for the rest of the school year is to aide our students in the mastery of the remaining curriculum with supportive teacher feedback on a daily basis. Student attendance will be determined by either logging in to the provided resources or by handing in paper and pencil activities based on your child’s grade level. The district will not be using traditional grading during the fourth quarter. We do not feel, under the current circumstances, traditional grades would be appropriate or valid. Students will receive credit for a course by participating daily in their lessons and completing 60% of the work assigned. As to not overwhelm students, teachers are required to post two lessons per week per major subject. Related arts teachers will be posting one assignment per week. The assignments will be staggered on different days of the week. Students in grades K and 1 will continue to receive packets of paper and pencil assignments to complete. Each building principal will be following up this message with a directive specific to their own building and grade levels.

We recognize this change may be difficult for some and we will provide any and all support to assist in our student’s success. Please call or e-mail your child’s building principal with any questions or concerns. More information will follow in the coming days and weeks.
Continue to stay healthy and safe and as always remain PATRIOT PROUD!
Click here to read the Continuity of Education Plan for Pittston Area School District.

div.p: This brief video was created to help reveal some of the unique learning opportunities our district has to offer. We also hope this video will assist families or individuals moving into our area learn more about our quality schools, outstanding staff, and exceptional students so an educated and comfortable decision can be made when parents are considering sending their children to our schools.
